hints_html:
This is a problem that can be solved using the formula

\(V = \int_{a}^{b} \pi f(x)^{2}\, dx\)
hints_latex:
This is a problem that can be solved using the formula

$V = \int_{a}^{b} \pi f(x)^{2}\, dx$
hints_raw:
This is a problem that can be solved using the formula

<math>
V = \int_{a}^{b} \pi f(x)^{2}\, dx
</math>
question: 1 (e)
sols_html:
Applying the formula gives

\[\begin{aligned} V &= \int_{a}^{b}\pi f(x)^{2} \, dx \\ &= \pi\int_{1}^{2} (x+x^{2})^{2}\, dx \\ &= \pi\int_{1}^{2} (x^{2} + 2x^{3} + x^{4}) \, dx \\ &= \pi \left.\left( \frac{x^{3}}{3} + \frac{x^{4}}{2} + \frac{x^{5}}{5} \right) \right|_{1}^{2} \\ &= \pi \left(\frac{8}{3} + \frac{16}{2} + \frac{32}{5} - \frac{1}{3} - \frac{1}{2} - \frac{1}{5} \right)\\ &= \pi \left(\frac{7}{3} + \frac{15}{2} + \frac{31}{5} \right) \\ &= \pi \left(\frac{70}{30} + \frac{225}{30} + \frac{186}{30} \right) \\ &= \frac{481\pi}{30}\end{aligned}\]

as required.
sols_latex:
Applying the formula gives

\begin{align*}
V &= \int_{a}^{b}\pi f(x)^{2}  \, dx \\
&= \pi\int_{1}^{2} (x+x^{2})^{2}\, dx \\
&= \pi\int_{1}^{2} (x^{2} + 2x^{3} + x^{4}) \, dx \\
&= \pi \left.\left( \frac{x^{3}}{3} + \frac{x^{4}}{2} + \frac{x^{5}}{5} \right) \right|_{1}^{2} \\
&= \pi \left(\frac{8}{3} + \frac{16}{2} + \frac{32}{5} - \frac{1}{3} - \frac{1}{2} - \frac{1}{5} \right)\\
&= \pi \left(\frac{7}{3} + \frac{15}{2} + \frac{31}{5} \right) \\
&= \pi \left(\frac{70}{30} + \frac{225}{30} + \frac{186}{30} \right) \\
&= \frac{481\pi}{30}
\end{align*}

as required.
sols_raw:
Applying the formula gives

<math>
\begin{align}
V &= \int_{a}^{b}\pi f(x)^{2}  \, dx \\
&= \pi\int_{1}^{2} (x+x^{2})^{2}\, dx \\
&= \pi\int_{1}^{2} (x^{2} + 2x^{3} + x^{4}) \, dx \\
&= \pi \left. \left( \frac{x^{3}}{3} + \frac{x^{4}}{2} + \frac{x^{5}}{5} \right) \right|_{1}^{2} \\
&= \pi \left(\frac{8}{3} + \frac{16}{2} + \frac{32}{5} - \frac{1}{3} - \frac{1}{2} - \frac{1}{5} \right)\\
&= \pi \left(\frac{7}{3} + \frac{15}{2} + \frac{31}{5} \right) \\
&= \pi \left(\frac{70}{30} + \frac{225}{30} + \frac{186}{30} \right) \\
&= \frac{481\pi}{30}
\end{align}
</math>

as required.
statement_html: Calculate the volume of the solid obtained by rotating the region above the x-axis, below the curve \(y = x + x^{2}\) and between the lines \(x=1\) and \(x=2\) about the x-axis
statement_latex:
Calculate the volume of the solid obtained by rotating the region above
the \emph{x}-axis, below the curve $y = x + x^{2}$ and between the lines
$x=1$ and $x=2$ about the \emph{x}-axis
statement_raw: Calculate the volume of the solid obtained by rotating the region above the ''x''-axis, below the curve <math> y = x + x^{2}</math> and between the lines <math>x=1 </math> and <math> x=2 </math> about the ''x''-axis
